Question
========
Which statement about using packages is correct?

Answerlist
----------
* After installing a package, you must still call `library(packageName)` to use it in a session
* Running `library(packageName)` will automatically install missing packages
* Packages from GitHub are always higher quality than those on CRAN
* You should always install every dependency manually, even if R offers to handle them

Solution
========
Installing and loading are separate steps; you install once, then load with `library()` in each session where you need the package.

Answerlist
----------
* True
* False
* False
* False
